titleStmt.title: Henry D. McHenry to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4342

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Hartford Oct 13~ 1863
Gov Bramlett
Dr Sir

I send herewith a Petition to get C W Hunter released from a fine imposed against him for solemnizing the rights of Matrimony with authority. He was a Justice of the Peace & supposed he was authorized and it was only one coupled he married & the fine imposed was $25. He is a poor man & cant well afford to pay the fine He was afterward authorized by the Court to solemize marriage

I am very truly
Henry D McHenry
Remit all except costs & fees Oct 17th 1863
enclose to Col J P McHenry Henry D McHenry

We the undersigned citizens of Ohio County respectfully Petition His Excellency The Governor to remit a fine imposed by The Ohio Circuit Court at its last September Term against Charles W Hunter for marrying a couple without being authorized so to do by the County Court,
Oct 13th 1863-

L Nall
Alf Nall
R P Nall
J. G. Horn
W H, Nall
Remus Gibson
J. T Bent
W G,, Davis
D S Hill Judge Ohio County court
S Manzy
Wm Hardwick
Titus Bennett
Robert B Blevines
W, B, Robinson
John Graham
John K Oglisbey
R. S. Moreley Clk Ohio Co: Ct:
A, Woodward
Ed, B. Ellis
A, L, Morton Clk Ohio Cir Ct
W H. Davidson D. C,
A B Bond Post. M.
W H Miller
